intro: Upopion pinnatum, commonly known as the featherleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of white and yellow. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Upopion pinnatum is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
